name: Kaviraj Gosaye
tagline: Data Engineer • MSc AI • Google DeepMind Scholar
aboutme: I’m a Graduate Data Engineer with an AI background, focused on building scalable data workflows and end-to-end solutions. I enjoy working across data, software and ML, especially where clean engineering unlocks real-world impact.

bullets: Training on C# and Asp.net received prior to immersion into company
Worked on coding automation tests for DayForce payroll system
Selenium, SpecFlow and FitNesse tools were used to execute test cases
Azure DevOps was used as Project Management tool
Worked collaboratively with web mastering team
Web pages for specific companies were created and populated based on company requirements
CMS tools that were used are SiteCore and Umbraco
Jira tool was used as Project Management tool

awards.title: Google DeepMind Scholarship 2023-2024
body: Recipient of the fully funded Google DeepMind Scholarship for the MSc Artificial Intelligence at Queen Mary University of London.

"The DeepMind Scholarship means all to me. Without it, I would never have been able to experience studying abroad in the UK at such a prestigious university. The scholarship represents hope for academic learners like me who wish to pursue further studies. Getting this scholarship is inspiring considering that I am from Mauritius, a small African island in the Indian Ocean and this recognition truly humbles me."

publications.venue: International Conference for Advancement in Technology (ICONAT) 2022
details: Title: A Mobile Application for Fruit Fly Identification using Deep Transfer Learning: A Case Study for Mauritius

This paper describes a fruit fly identification system using Deep Learning. The system is deployed on a mobile application. The main usage of such application is to identify and counteract against fruit flies that cause harm to agriculture and the economy.

projects.title: Deeper Networks for Image Classification
projects.description: This is an analysis of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) on the MNIST and CIFAR10 datasets. The project evaluates the performance of four models: InceptionV3, VGG16, ResNet50, and MobileNetV2

projects.title: Vision Toolkit
projects.description: Vision Toolkit is a project showcasing various basic computer vision tools. The toolkit includes: 1. Image Rotation, 2. Convolution and Filters, 3. Color Histogram, 4. Similarity Descriptor, 5. Background Extractor

projects.title: AI Route Finder
projects.description: This project is an AI route finder for the London Tube using an agenda-based search mechanism. It implements and compares four algorithms: 1. Breadth-First Search (BFS), 2. Depth-First Search (DFS), 3. Uniform Cost Search (UCS), 4. Best-First Search (Heuristic Search)

projects.title: Apes Anticipation Simulation
projects.description: ROS package simulates an experiment to test if great apes can anticipate human false beliefs using a Bayesian network.

projects.title: Fruit Fly Application
projects.description: A Flutter mobile application that allows identification of fruit flies using Deep Learning.

projects.title: Infinity Robot
projects.description: An automatic seeding machine that makes use of a rover, a robot arm and sensors. This project won the first prize in UoM Hackathon 2020 and was presented for UoM Robotics Lab launching ceremony.

competitions.title: UoM Web Competition
competitions.description: Winner of the UoM Web Competition in 2019. A website had to be developed in 24hrs from scratch.

competitions.title: MCB InovApp Competition

competitions.title: UoM App Competition
